title: Veigar's E buff (PBE 3/3/2015

embed.description: This is a WORK IN PROGRESS POST - Today' s Patch out but the PBE still down ] The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers!

body:
Just posting this to point it out to everyone, Veigar's E now stops dashes and stuns you if you do attempt to dash through it (had a feeling he'd get more than just a buff to his Q)

Heres hoping they buff it a bit more and remove the cast time on it.

Edit: Cast time on E is confirmed to be gone as well.

replies.body:
I'm glad they're making it stop dashes. That makes it a more effective zoning tool.

However, I don't think this addresses the fundamental problem with the new E: it's a "stun" that should never stun a non-stupid target who isn't already CC'd. Outside of rare situations where a person would prefer to get stunned for about 2s (and possibly eat a full burst rotation) rather than waiting 3s for the walls to collapse, there's no reason for someone to stun themselves on this wall. But that's the only way it can actually stun someone: if they stun themselves by choosing to run (or dash) into it.

A zoning-focused E sounds pretty cool. The problem is that his kit is built around the ability to stun (not merely zone) a target. Especially now that his Q is a skillshot, he can't do a full rotation on someone (or stop them from killing him) unless he stacks his stun on top of someone who's already stunned.

It just bothers me that there's no reason for anyone to be stunned unless they just don't know how his cage works. If you want to give the enemy a decision about whether to run into the wall or not, there has to be **some** reason why they'd want to do that, or else it just punishes ignorance of how the Champion works with no strategic depth.

Event Horizon needs **[a new mechanic of some kind](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/OEuzazm2-veigars-event-horizon-needs-a-new-mechanic-lets-come-up-with-ideas)** to be an interesting, useful skill again. It should not be a "throw this on the ground somewhere and hope somebody runs into it" spell.

Much like Urgot's ultimate, the Event Horizon cage is simply attached to the wrong kit.

I guess if they dodge his skillshots wrong, an enemy could run into a wall, but that means they probably actually dodged his damage...
His old E used to do the same... hopeful of more Veigar buffs :D
No his old E didn't. They finish their dashes before being stun. This is a buff to the cage.

Sorry, didn't read it properly. The old Veigar cage would stop flashes/dashes by stunning them, but they would still get out. Thought this was what the PBE notes meant, not also making them stop at the cage perimeter

His old cage would not stun people who flashed over without touching the wall. It only stunned enemies that physically dash through it. Some examples that could 'flash' over his old wall without getting stunned are summoner Flash, Kassadin Ult, Talon's Cutthroat, Katarina's Shunpo, Fiddlestick's ult, TF's ult, Master Yi's Alpha Strike, Urgot's ult and Fiora's ult.

...which are also able to get out of his new E unaffected. Those moves are blinks, which instantly move you from A to B. In contrast to dashes (which are going to be stopped) which are just moving you really fast from A to B.

except they aren't

"Event Horizon (E) now stops dashes early (such as Graves E or LeBlanc W) that come in contact with the wall. This does NOT work for Flash / Blinks (such as Ezreal's E or Kass R)"

That's exactly what I said, isn't it?

Veigar's new E stops dashes when someone tries to dash through the wall. It doesn't affect blinks (like Riftwalk, Summoner Flash, Cutthroat/Kneecap, Shunpo, Glacial Path, the movement part of Crowstorm and Gate, HKPR, Arcane Shift and such things). Also, it should not affect dashes that make you untargetable, like Alpha Strike, Blade Waltz or Troll Pole.

Honestly, I would like to see another .25 seconds cut off. I feel that when selecting someone with low mobility, you should be making a tradeoff. If a xerath is close enough for you to land a nice stun on him, he deserves to get bursted. But .5 seconds is still enough time to flash. Its also enough time for any mobile champ to jump away. Obviously, it depends on how much they buff his W, but I feel like his stun needs to be more reliable than it is at .75 seconds. The q buff is nice, though.
